member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Action.RegisterInVS
member.summary: Registers this action as a Visual Studio command. If false, you can still bind a keystroke to this action in the CodeRush Options dialog on the Shortcuts page. If true, this action can be available in the Visual Studio Options dialog on the Keyboard page. If you want to place this action in a menu or on a command bar, then you should set this property to true. Otherwise no shortcut text will be displayed on corresponding menu item.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Action.RegisterInCR
member.summary: Registers this action with CodeRush. If false, this action may still be available in the Visual Studio Options dialog on the Keyboard page. If you want to place this action in a menu or on a command bar, then you must set this property to true. If true, you can bind a keystroke to this command in the CodeRush Options dialog on the Shortcuts page.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Action.SyncCRAndVSShortcuts
member.summary: Keeps VS shortcut in sync with CodeRush shortcut. Note, opposite is not true. Shortcut set in CodeRush Options dialog will be also set in Visual Studio Options dialog on the Keyboard page. VS shortcut is added as Global key mapping. This option has no effect when either RegisterInVS or RegisterInCR is set to false.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Action.AllowCustomizeVSShortcut
member.summary: Shows command on Tools->Options...->Keyboard page. If set to false, user will not be able to customize shortcut for registered Visual Studio command. This option has no effect when RegisterInVS is set to false.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Action.RegisterMenuButton
member.summary: Registers this menu button for Visual Studio command. If RegisterInVS is set to true, corresponding shortcut for VS command will be displayed.

member.summary: A collection of expected parameters for this action.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Action.Position
member.summary: Sets the position for this action in the specified ParentMenu. The first position is one. If you specify zero for this value, the item will appended to the end of the menu. If you specify a negative number, the menu item position will be calculated from the end of the menu (e.g., if Position equals -1 then this menu item will be inserted before the last entry).

member.name: M:DevExpress.DXCore.Adornments.Painters.CoordinateAdornmentPainter.SetScalingDenominators(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the denominators used to calculate HorizontalScale, HorizontalCharScale, and VerticalScale (defined in PathPainter). Descendants should call this in their constructor to specify the scale at which the coordinates they send to NewPt and NewCharPt were determined.
member.param: The value for the WordWidthDenominator. The HorizontalScale field will be set to the sum of the width of the range to highlight (in pixels) plus TextView.SpaceWidth times WordWidthExtraChars, all divided by this amount.

The value for the WordWidthExtraChars field. This value is the number of extra character widths that should be added to the range width (that we're going to highlight) before dividing by WordWidthDenominator. The HorizontalScale field will be set to the sum of the width of the range to highlight (in pixels) plus TextView.SpaceWidth times this value, all divided by this WordWidthDenominator.
The value for the CharWidthDenominator. The HorizontalCharScale field will be set to the TextView's SpaceWidth divided by this amount.
The value for the LineHeightDenominator. The VerticalScale field will be set to the TextView's LineHeight divided by this amount.

member.name: M:DevExpress.DXCore.Adornments.Painters.CoordinateAdornmentPainter.SetScalingDenominators(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the denominators used to calculate _HorizontalScale, _HorizontalCharScale, and _VerticalScale (defined in PathPainter). Descendants should call this in their constructor to specify the scale at which the coordinates they send to NewPt and NewCharPt were determined. For PointHighlighter descendants, _HorizontalScale and _HorizontalCharScale will be identical, meaning that there will be no difference between calling NewPt and NewCharPt.
member.param: The value for the _CharWidthDenominator. The _HorizontalCharScale field will be set to the GdiTextView's SpaceWidth divided by this amount.
The value for the _LineHeightDenominator. The _VerticalScale field will be set to the GdiTextView's LineHeight divided by this amount.

member.summary: Gets the anchor location after clipboard operation. Use this property instead of Source.AnchorLine and Source.AnchorColumn, they will return invalid values, if the code was modified. Returns null if clipboard operation was done outside of the VS VsTextBuffer. This can also be null if the document that the clipboard operation was performed on is closed.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ClipboardEntry.AnchorPoint
member.summary: Gets the Anchor as SourcePoint. Returns SourcePoint.Empty if Location is null.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ClipboardEntry.CaretPoint
member.summary: Gets the caret location after clipboard operation. Use this property instead of Source.AnchorLine and Source.AnchorColumn, they will return invalid values, if the code was modified. Returns null if clipboard operation was done outside of the VS VsTextBuffer.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ClipboardEntry.Document
member.summary: Gets the document of the clipboard operation. Returns null if clipboard operation was done outside ot the VS Document. (Use HasDocument to see if Document property is set.) Do not hold on to this reference for extended periods of time. User operations performed after the clipboard operation took place (e.g., closing a document) can render this reference invalid.

member.summary: Returns true if clipboard entry has Source property set.

The text used if a button is bound to this command.
A hint that describes this command.
If true, added command will appear on the "Tools->Options...->Keyboard" option page.
member.returns: Returns the name command added. If the command already exists or if an exception is thrown, this method returns null.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.CommandServices.DeleteAllStartingWith(System.String,System.String[])

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.CommandServices.DeleteAllStartingWith(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Deletes all Visual Studio commands starting with the specified prefix and category, except for the commands listed in the given "exceptions" string array.
member.param: The prefix of the commands to delete. Any commands in the specified category that start with this prefix will be deleted.
The category to search for. For example, in the command "Edit.Cut", "Edit" is the category.
A string array containing a list of commands that should not be deleted.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.CommandServices.GetFirstStartingWith(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the first Visual Studio command starting with the specified prefix in the specified category.
member.param: The prefix to search for.
The category to search in. For example, in the command "Edit.Cut", "Edit" is the category.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.CommandServices.Exists(System.String)

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.RefactoringProviderBase.ExclusiveAvailabilityBehavior
member.summary: Determines what will happen when the Refactor Action is invoked without parameters and this is the only provider available. Default behavior is to immediately apply the provider. However for certain providers having unexpected or potentially surprising side-effects, it may make more sense to show the Refactor menu, which provides an opportunity to review impact (through the preview hint) before committing.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.AutoActivate
member.summary: If true, this provider will be automatically activated while it is executing and deactivated afterwards. If false, the provider needs to call the Activate and Deactivate methods of this ContentProvider at the appropriate times.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.AutoUndo
member.summary: If true, an undo unit will automatically be created to collect all text changes made by this provider during the Apply event. If false, the provider is responsible to handle the undo stack itself.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.Picker
member.summary: Assign to a DXCore picker component to get user input before applying this provider.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.CodeIssueMessage
member.summary: Set a unique string that connects this content provider to a particular code issue. This string should also be passed to the ea.AddIssue() method, called from the IssueProviders CheckCodeIssues event.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.RequiresSubMenuChoice
member.summary: Specifies whether this content provider is applied only when a sub menu item is chosen. If there are no sub menus added to this content provider, then it can be applied by choosing it from a menu.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.SolvedIssues
member.summary: Returns a list of code issue provider names that this content provider may fix.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.UIStrings
member.summary: Contains text used for Refactor/Code UI (e.g., the Refactor/Code menu and hint). NOTE: This text may be modified by a RefactorProvider's CheckAvailability event.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.NeedsSelection
member.summary: Set NeedsSelection to true if this content provider requires a selection to determine availability. This is used by the Code Issue architecture to select the range of the issue before a check is made (through the CheckAvailability event) to see if this content provider can provide a fix to the issue in question.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.Image
member.summary: Sets the bitmap image for this this smart tag item. Images are optional, but can be useful for displaying in the context menu.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.ImageBackColor
member.summary: Sets the image background color for this smart tag item. It is used to determine which color is to be treated as transparent in the bitmap assigned to the Image property.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.ParentMenu
member.summary: The name of the parent menu where this content provider should be moved.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.CheckAvailability
member.summary: Occurs when the availability of this provider in the current context is being tested. Handle this event to indicate what conditions this provider is available or recommended under.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.LanguageSupported
member.summary: Handle this optional event if you want to restrict your provider to one or more programming languages. If you do not handle this event, your provider will be available in all programming languages.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.VisualStudioSupported
member.summary: Handle this optional event if you want to restrict your provider to one or more Visual Studio versions. If you do not handle this event, your provider will be available in any Visual Studio version.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.SetUp
member.summary: Occurs immediately before the Apply event is fired. Handle this optional event to perform any necessary setup before the provider is applied.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.TearDown
member.summary: Occurs immediately after the Apply event is fired. Handle this optional event to perform any necessary clean up after the provider is applied.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.Apply
member.summary: Occurs when the provider needs to be applied. Handle this event to apply this provider to the currently existing code in the active TextDocument. NOTE: This event will never fire if the provider is not available so code that checks for provider availability is not necessary in a handler for this event.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.Cancelled
member.summary: Occurs when this provider has been cancelled. Implement code that will cancel this provider inside a handler for this event.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.PreparePreview
member.summary: Occurs when the user highlights this provider inside the Refactor menu. Handle this optional event to display any additional visual information that can preview the impact of this provider. If you handle this event, you should clean up your preview in a HidePreview event handler.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.HidePreview
member.summary: Occurs when a menu item inside the Refactor menu is no longer highlighted. This can happen when the user selects a different provider, when the user executes the selected provider, or when the Refactor menu closes. If you display visual information in the ShowPreview event, you should also handle this event to clean up the preview.

member.name: E:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ContentProvider.GetAvailabilityContextString
member.summary: Occurs before the smart tag manager determines command order based on historic usage. If your provider has distinct states that you would like separate entries for, handle this event and assign a unique string to the Context property of the event args that represents the distinct state. For example, the Inline Temp provider handles this event and sets the Context property to \"1\" when only one instance of the temporary variable exists."

member.name: T:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint
member.summary: A DocPoint is a two-dimensional location inside a text document. The point is stored in row and column coordinates, with additional row offset and column offset percentages to allow for accurate placement within a row or column. DocPoints may be optionally bound to the text surrounding them, ensuring that they move if text before the DocPoint is inserted or removed.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new DocPoint. The BindingOption for this new DocPoint will be BindingOption.NoBinding.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.#ctor(DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint)
member.summary: Creates a new DocPoint based on an existing DocPoint. The BindingOption for this new DocPoint will be BindingOption.NoBinding. Calculated Row and Column values will be copied from the specified prototype DocPoint into this new DocPoint.
member.param: The prototype DocPoint to base this new one on.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.#ctor(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourcePoint)
member.summary: Creates a new DocPoint based on the given SourcePoint. The BindingOption for this new DocPoint will be BindingOption.NoBinding.
member.param: The SourcePoint to base this DocPoint on.

member.summary: Creates a new DocPoint. The BindingOption for this new DocPoint will be BindingOption.NoBinding.

Column value.

member.summary: Creates a new DocPoint. The BindingOption for this new DocPoint will be BindingOption.NoBinding.

member.summary: Binds this DocPoint to its row and column, so this DocPoint stays with its surrounding text when it moves due to edits.

member.summary: Returns true if this DocPoint was bound to the row and column where it was dropped.

member.summary: Returns true if this DocPoint was bound to the row and column where it was dropped.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.PercentageOfColumnWidth
member.summary: The percentage of the Column Width. This value is multiplied by the active column width to determine a precise X coordinate in the editor.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.PercentageOfRowHeight
member.summary: The percentage of the row height. This value is multiplied by the active row height to determine a precise Y coordinate in the editor.

member.summary: The row number.

member.summary: The Column number.

member.name: F:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.BindingOption.NoBinding
member.summary: There is no binding on this point. As text is added and removed, it will always stay at the row and column where it was initially dropped.

member.name: F:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.BindingOption.BindToRow
member.summary: As text is added and removed from the file, this DocPoint will shift down or up to stay with its surrounding text. Only the row is bound with this option; the column position remains static.

member.name: F:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DocPoint.BindingOption.BindToRowAndColumn
member.summary: As text is added and removed from the file, this DocPoint will shift down, right, left, or up to stay with its surrounding text.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.TextDocument
member.summary: The TextDocument that will be parsed. Null if the input to the parser will be a file on disk.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.FileName
member.summary: The name of the document that will be parsed.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.NodeBefore
member.summary: The sibling node preceding the range that is incrementally parsed. This property may be null if the parsed range is inserted as the first child node of the Parent. This property will be null if ParseType equals ParseType.Full.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.NodeAfter
member.summary: The sibling node following the range that is incrementally parsed. This property may be null if the parsed range is appended as the last child node of the Parent. This property will be null if ParseType equals ParseType.Full.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.DeletedNodes
member.summary: A LanguageElementCollection of deleted children of Parent. This collection may be empty if no nodes are deleted, which can happen during an incremental parse when text is inserted between nodes. This property will be null if ParseType equals ParseType.Full.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.Parent
member.summary: The LanguageElement that parents the nodes to be reparsed. This property will be null if ParseType equals ParseType.Full.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.ParseRange
member.summary: The SourceRange that will be reparsed. This property will be SourceRange.Empty if ParseType equals ParseType.Full.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.BeforeParseEventArgs.ParseType
member.summary: The type of parse. This this property equals ParseType.Full, then the entire document is parsed. If it's ParseType.Incremental, then only a portion of the document is parsed.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.AfterParseEventArgs.ParseResult
member.summary: The node containing the newly-parsed nodes. This will be a FileNode if the ParseType equals ParseType.Full, and will be the parent of the incrementally parsed nodes if ParseType equals ParseType.Incremental.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.AfterParseEventArgs.LanguageElement
member.summary: The node containing the newly-parsed nodes. This property is obsolete. Use ParseResult instead.

The line number, starting at one.
The line column offset, starting at one (tabs count as a single column offset).
The color to paint the text. The text will be painted in this color or the highlight text color if text is selected.
The background color to behind the text. The background will be painted in this color or the highlight color if text is selected.
The color for a line drawn around or under the text. The line will be painted in this color or the highlight line color if text is selected.
The style of a line drawn around or under the text.
True if the text should be bold.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.EditorPaintEventArgs.DrawConnection(System.Drawing.Pen,DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourcePoint,DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourcePoint,DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ConnectionStyle,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a single line connecting the start SourcePoint to the end SourcePoint, using the specified pen.
member.param: The Pen to use for drawing the line.
The start SourcePoint.
The end SourcePoint.

The ConnectionStyle for this line. Specify ConnectionStyle.Inside to have the line connect the inside edges of the start and end SourcePoints, or use ConnectionStyle.Outside to connect the outside edges of the start and end SourcePoints.
If the connection is neither naturally horizontal or vertical (e.g., diagonal), then setting this option to false will force the connection to be composed of horizontal and vertical lines.
The number of pixels to shift horizontal lines down, and vertical lines right. For example, to make a horizontal line appear two pixels higher than it normally would, use -2.

The ConnectionStyle for this line. Specify ConnectionStyle.Inside to have the line connect the inside edges of the start and end SourcePoints, or use ConnectionStyle.Outside to connect the outside edges of the start and end SourcePoints.
If the connection is neither naturally horizontal or vertical (e.g., diagonal), then setting this option to false will force the connection to be composed of horizontal and vertical lines.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.KeyboardServices.SendShortcutToIDE
member.summary: Command event handlers can change this property to determine whether the key bound to their CodeRush command should go on to the IDE for further processing. This property is initialized by CodeRush before calling the CodeRushCommand's DoExecute() method. The initialized value is determined by the user-specified binding option established in the Shortcuts option dialog. This property is checked immediately after calling DoExecute(), so if your event handler doesn't touch it, it will respect the user's settings.

member.summary: Returns true if the specified string is a legal simple identifier for the active language. A simple identifier typically starts with an alpha character, and can include numbers and the underscore character. Parens, brackets, and internal whitespace around member access operators (e.g., "A . B . C" instead of "A.B.C") are not included in this evaluation.
member.param: The identifier to test.

member.param: The string to test.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.LanguageServices.ToFileExt(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a specified language ID to a file extension by replacing all illegal chars with appropriate strings and adding the dot before the first symbol. If the language ID is null or empty, the method returns an empty string.
member.param: The language ID (e.g., "CSharp", "Basic", "C/C++").
member.returns: The file extension, keeping legal file name characters and preceded by the leading ".".

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.LanguageServices.Parse(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.ParserContext)
member.summary: Parses the specified source range of the given text document with the given context and returns the LanguageElement that represents it. Nodes parsed in the specified range will be appended to the end of the context's nodes. Does not trigger the BeforeParse or AfterParse events, nor does this method call BindToCode -- calling client code must do that (this allows the calling code to bind only the nodes within the parse range, and also append any trailing nodes to the end of the newly-parsed nodes).
member.param: The parser context to use.
member.returns: Returns the LanguageElement representing the specified source range, or null if an error occurred.

member.summary: Parses the specified source range of the active text document with the given context and returns the LanguageElement that represents it.
member.param: The context being invalidated.

The CompilerDirective to add compiler directives.
The source range to parse.
member.returns: Returns the LanguageElement representing the specified source range, or null if an error occurred.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.IMarker.Style
member.summary: The style of this marker. One of Standard, Transient, or System. Standard markers stay until they are picked up by the user. Transient markers stay on the stack until they are picked up or the line they reside on is edited by the user. System markers are like Transient markers, and are dropped automatically by DXCore plug-ins that offer navigation services.

member.name: T:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.MultiSelect.ISelectionHighlighter
member.summary: Manages the highlighting of multi-selection intances.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.MultiSelect.MultiSelect.GetHighlightRange(DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextView,DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourceRange)
member.summary: Returns a range of code to highlight, which may be different from the actual code selected. This is done to work around a cosmetic display bug in the 11.1 version of the BlockHighlighter control when highlighting leading white space, and also to be more consistent with user expectations (users think of a member as starting and ending with code, not white space, but a cut or copy should include leading and trailing white space).

member.summary: Adds the specified PartialSelection to this MultiSelect instance, highlighting the selection onscreen, and clears the Visual Studio selection.

member.summary: Clears all selections from this MultiSelect instance.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.GdiPointHighlighter.SetScalingDenominators(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the denominators used to calculate _HorizontalScale, _HorizontalCharScale, and _VerticalScale (defined in PathPainter). Descendants should call this in their constructor to specify the scale at which the coordinates they send to NewPt and NewCharPt were determined. For PointHighlighter descendants, _HorizontalScale and _HorizontalCharScale will be identical, meaning that there will be no difference between calling NewPt and NewCharPt.
member.param: The value for the _CharWidthDenominator. The _HorizontalCharScale field will be set to the TextView's SpaceWidth divided by this amount.
The value for the _LineHeightDenominator. The _VerticalScale field will be set to the TextView's LineHeight divided by this amount.

member.summary: Ancestor class for graphic elements that paint over code specified by a SourceRange.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.GdiRangeHighlighter.CalculateScale(DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextView,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method is called before calling GetPoints in descendant classes.
member.param: The TextView to paint in.
The width of the code line we're highlighting.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.GdiRangeHighlighter.SetScalingDenominators(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the denominators used to calculate _HorizontalScale, _HorizontalCharScale, and _VerticalScale (defined in PathPainter). Descendants should call this in their constructor to specify the scale at which the coordinates they send to NewPt and NewCharPt were determined.
member.param: The value for the _WordWidthDenominator. The _HorizontalScale field will be set to the sum of the width of the range to highlight (in pixels) plus TextView.SpaceWidth times _WordWidthExtraChars, all divided by this amount.

The value for the _WordWidthExtraChars field. This value is the number of extra character widths that should be added to the range width (that we're going to highlight) before dividing by _WordWidthDenominator. The _HorizontalScale field will be set to the sum of the width of the range to highlight (in pixels) plus TextView.SpaceWidth times this value, all divided by this _WordWidthDenominator.
The value for the _CharWidthDenominator. The _HorizontalCharScale field will be set to the TextView's SpaceWidth divided by this amount.
The value for the _LineHeightDenominator. The _VerticalScale field will be set to the TextView's LineHeight divided by this amount.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.GdiRangeHighlighter.Range
member.summary: The range associated with this graphic element. All code within this range will be highlighted, with this graphic element repeated once per line.

member.summary: Outputs the anchor and active points of the active selection via the anchorPoint and activePoint parameters. If no text is selected, activePoint will represent the active caret position. If no document is open, aActivePoint and anchorPoint will be set to empty SourcePoints. member.param: The TextDocument to parse.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ParseIfTextChanged

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.PromoteToSiblings(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.LanguageElement@,DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.LanguageElement@)
member.summary: Converts firstElement and secondElement non-siblings to their closest parents which are siblings. Returns true if successful, or false if firstElement and secondElement do not share a common parent. Note that if one of these elements parents the other, then both of these LanguageElements will point to the same parent. If the specified elements are already siblings, they will leave this method unchanged. If one element is a detail node and the other is a child node, each will be set to the common parent.
member.param: The first LanguageElement to check.
The second LanguageElement to check.

member.returns: Returns true if the specified namespace exists in a using reference (or imports statement), false otherwise.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.RegionNodeIsValid(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.LanguageElement)
member.summary: Returns true if the specified node is a valid region node. This method is useful for iterating through parent nodes of regions. The topmost region node is used simply as a container for all other regions in the file, and if that node is passed, this method will return false.
member.param: The node to check.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ResetSourceUpdate
member.summary: Resets internal source update counter, so parsing can be normally resumed.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.BeginUpdate
member.summary: This method suspends parsing and is useful if you plan to make several repeated changes to the code. If you call this inside plug-in, you must guarantee a call to EndUpdate() (e.g., placed in a finally block) so normal parsing can resume.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.EndUpdate
member.summary: Marks the end of an update session. You must call this once for every call to BeginUpdate().

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.EndUpdate(System.Boolean)

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.FileNode
member.summary: Returns the file node for the active document. This property is obsolete. Use CodeRush.Source.ActiveFileNode instead.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.CodeActive
member.summary: Returns active LanguageElement for active IAspSourceFile.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.Active
member.summary: Returns the language element at the caret.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveWithoutParse
member.summary: Returns the language element at the caret.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveDeclaration
member.summary: Gets the variable, initialized variable, implicit variable or constant declaration that contains the caret. Returns null if the caret is not contained inside declaration.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveMemberName
member.summary: Gets the name of the active member (Method, Property, Event, Field, etc.), that is immediately parented by a Class, Struct, or Interface.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveMethodName
member.summary: Returns the name of the active method. Returns an empty string if the caret is not inside a method.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveMethodOrPropertyAccessorName
member.summary: Returns the name of the method or property accessor containing the caret.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveClassName
member.summary: Gets the name of the active class. Note that if the caret is inside an embedded class (e.g., a class inside a class), only the name of the innermost class is returned. Returns an empty string if the caret is not inside a class.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveTypeName
member.summary: Gets the name of the active class, struct or interface. Note that if the caret is inside an embedded type (e.g., a type inside a type), only the name of the innermost type is returned. Returns an empty string if the caret is not outside a type.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveComment

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveXMLDocComment
member.summary: Returns the XML Documentation Comment for the active node (or for the first parent of the active node that an XML documentation comment can be bound to). Note: This method can return XMLDocComments that do not contain the caret.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ActiveNamespaceName
member.summary: Gets the name of the active namespace. Note that if the caret is inside an embedded namespace (e.g., a namespace inside a namespace), only the name of the innermost namespace is returned. Returns an empty string if the caret is not inside a namespace.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.CompilerDirectiveRootNode
member.summary: Returns the compiler directive root node for the current file, or null if the current language does not support compiler directives. The root node's children (accessed through its Nodes property) are the CompilerDirectives for this file. This root node itself, however, is not an actual CompilerDirective for this file (even though its type is CompilerDirective, it does not represent an actual CompilerDirective -- it is merely the parent of the CompilerDirectives in this file).

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.InsideComment
member.summary: Returns true if caret is inside comment or xml doc comment. This property reflects the current state as determined by the parse tree, but it may not match recent edits on the current line. If you need to know if immediate recent changes on the line have placed the caret inside a comment, use CodeRush.Caret.InsideComment.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.InsideXMLDocComment
member.summary: Returns true if caret is inside xml doc comment.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.InsideAttribute
member.summary: Returns true if caret is indside attribute or attribute section.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.InsideString
member.summary: Returns true if caret is inside string. This property reflects the current state as determined by the parse tree, but it may not match recent edits on the current line. If you need to know if immediate recent changes on the line have placed the caret inside a string, use CodeRush.Caret.InsideString.

The root node's children (accessed through its Nodes property) are the RegionDirectives for this file. This root node itself, however, is not an actual RegionDirectives for this file (even though its type is RegionDirectives, it does not represent an actual RegionDirectives -- it is merely the parent of the regions in this file).

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.SelectedExpression

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.ParsingSuspended
member.summary: If true, the source model cache will report that parsing is unnecessary. This option is used for testing, and should never be set to true by a plug-in.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceModelServices.UsePostponedParsing
member.summary: If true, then language elements that implement on demand parsing will store tokens for later parse. On demand parse of such language elements will occur once NodeCount, Nodes, DetailNodeCount, DetailNodes or Comments properties are accessed.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.Sort
member.summary: Sorts this SourceRange collection by line number. SourceRanges closer to the top of the file are listed first.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.SortReverse
member.summary: Sorts this SourceRange collection by start point in reverse order. SourceRanges closer to the top of the file are listed last.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.InsertAndShift(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourceRange)
member.summary: Inserts the specified SourceRange into this collection, shifting other SourceRanges below it by the appropriate amount. If this SourceRange is inserted at the start or end of a previously-inserted SourceRange, the two SourceRanges are merged into one.
member.param: The SourceRange to insert.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.DeleteAndShift(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourceRange)
member.summary: Deletes the specified SourceRange from this collection, adjusting any nodes that follow the deletion up as necessary.
member.param: The SourceRange to delete.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.Overlay(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourceRange)
member.summary: Integrates the specified SourceRange with others in this collection, removing any existing SourceRanges that are fully overlapped by the new one, and merging partially-overlapped SourceRanges.
member.param: The SourceRange to overlay.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.Intersects(DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourceRange)
member.summary: Returns true if any of the SourceRanges in this collection intersect the specified SourceRange.
member.param: The SourceRange to check.

member.summary: Creates and returns SourceRange array.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.SourceRangeCollection.Last

member.name: T:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage
member.summary: Handles decoupled storage for plug-ins. Includes a property "LanguageID" that can create and select child storage objects for the purposes of language-specific storage (e.g., to support independent settings for C#, C++, Basic, etc.). Just set the LanguageID to the appropriate Language Identifier (e.g., "CSharp", "C/C++", "Basic", etc.), and then read and write normally. To activate the language-neutral storage object, set LanguageID to an empty string. If your code is inside a CodeRush Options page, you can get the LanguageID through the Options page's LanguageID property (also, you can handle the LanguageChanged event in your Options page to find out when the user wants to create settings for another programming language).

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.SetStorageObject
member.summary: Setups the active storage object -- INI or XML file.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.SetStorageObject(DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.IStorageObject)
member.summary: Setups the active storage object -- INI, XML or UserDefined.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a file extension for a specified LanguageID.
member.param: The language ID (e.g., "CSharp", "Basic", "C/C++").
member.returns: The file extension, keeping legal file name characters and preceded by the leading ".".

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.GetExtensionSerialized(System.String)
member.summary: Returns an extension for serialized objects, e.g. for templates.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.MakeReadPath(System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a path to a file inside a subfolder of the directory holding this storage object. The subfolder has the same root name as this storage object (typically the page name of your Options page). An appropriate language extension is inserted before the file extension of the specified file if this storage object has a programming language selected through the LanguageID property. So if your Options page name was "Templates" and the category was "Editor", and the specified language was C#, calling MakePath("HelloWorld.bin") might return (depending on the location of your CodeRush Settings folder) something like this:
"C:\Program Files\Dev Express\CodeRush\Settings\Editor\Templates\HelloWorld.CSharp.bin"
member.param: The name of the file to create (should be without path, but it should have an extension).
member.returns: The generated file path.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.SelectActiveStorageObject
member.summary: Activates the storage object associated with the _LanguageID field (called from set_LanguageID). This method ensures the requested storage object for the current _LanguageID is created if necessary.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.GetSubFolders(System.String)
member.summary: Returns all subfolders inside the specified folder as a Hashtable where key is the folder name and value is a DecoupledStorage object. Note that the value can be null if the folder contains subfolders but has no storage.
member.param: The parent folder to get subfolders.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.Clear
member.summary: Clears the contents of the active language-specific storage object (set through the LanguageID property). If LanguageID is empty (""), then the primary (language-neutral) storage object is cleared. To clear all storage objects, use ClearAll().

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.ClearAll
member.summary: Clears the contents of the storage object and any language-specific storage object children. To clear only the active storage object (set through the LanguageID property), use the Clear() method.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.UpdateStorage
member.summary: Commits changes to disk. If any language-specific storage object children have been created, that data is also committed to disk.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.LoadSerialized(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a serializable object from the specified file name (which should be without a path). If this method is called when this storage object is in a language-specific state (e.g., LanguageID = "CSharp"), the actual file name will have the LanguageID inserted before the file extension (e.g., "HelloWorld.bin" becomes "HelloWorld.CSharp.bin"). If this storage object is in a language-neutral state (e.g., LanguageID = ""), then the file name is unchanged.
member.param: The name of the file to load your serialized data from. This file name should have an extension (e.g., ".bin"), however it should *not* have a path (storage path is generated automatically by CodeRush).
member.returns: The deserialized object. Exceptions can be thrown in this method, so be sure to wrap calls to this method in a try/catch.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.LoadSerialized(System.String,System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationBinder)
member.summary: Loads a serializable object from the specified file name (which should be without a path). If this method is called when this storage object is in a language-specific state (e.g., LanguageID = "CSharp"), the actual file name will have the LanguageID inserted before the file extension (e.g., "HelloWorld.bin" becomes "HelloWorld.CSharp.bin"). If this storage object is in a language-neutral state (e.g., LanguageID = ""), then the file name is unchanged.
member.param: The name of the file to load your serialized data from. This file name should have an extension (e.g., ".bin"), however it should *not* have a path (storage path is generated automatically by CodeRush).
The SerializationBinder descendant to use to redirect types constructed during deserialization. Your SerializationBinder descendant must override the BindToType method.
member.returns: The deserialized object. Exceptions can be thrown in this method, so be sure to wrap calls to this method in a try/catch.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.SaveSerialized(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Saves a serializable object to the specified file name (which should be without a path). If this method is called when this storage object is in a language-specific state (e.g., LanguageID = "CSharp"), the actual file name will have the LanguageID inserted before the file extension (e.g., "HelloWorld.bin" becomes "HelloWorld.CSharp.bin"). If this storage object is in a language-neutral state (e.g., LanguageID = ""), then the file name is unchanged.
member.param: The object to serialize.

The name of the file to save your serialized data to. This file name should have an extension (e.g., ".bin"), however it should *not* have a path (storage path is generated automatically by CodeRush).>

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.ActiveStorage
member.summary: Returns the active storage object, which changes based on the LanguageID. If LanguageID is never specified then this property simply returns this.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.Folders
member.summary: Returns a Hashtable containing child DecoupledStorage objects for the nested folders.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.FileExtension
member.summary: Returns the file extension of the language-specific storage file (e.g., ".CSharp", ".Basic", etc.), or ".ini" if this storage object is in a language-neutral state and storage object is set to use Ini files. To change the programming language associated with this storage object, use the Language property.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.DecoupledStorage.LanguageID
member.summary: Sets or gets the programming language ID associated with this storage object. Setting a new language ID will have the effect of creating a new storage file with an extension matching the new language ID (minus any characters that are illegal in a file name). To change back to language-neutral storage, set this property to an empty string.

member.summary: Returns a newly-created NamespaceCollection for the specified namespace name. Returns an empty collection if the specified namespace is not declared in this file. Most collections returned will only contain a single entry for a given namespace. However because it is possible to declare the same namespace in a single file more than once, this method returns a collection to accomodate that possibility.
member.param: The name of the namespace to find.

member.summary: Wraps code around the currently selected text. Text may be inserted on the line above the selection and on the line after the selection, as well as to the left and right of each line.
member.param: A string array to insert above the current selection.
A string array to insert below the current selection.
The text to place on the left side of each line.
The text to place on the right side of each line.

Determines where the left text will be inserted. If trailingColumn is positive, the left text will start at this specified column (unless code on this line starts before the specified column, in which case the left text will be inserted just before the first non-white space character on the line). If leadingColumn is one, then left text will be placed at the start of each line. If trailingColumn is int.MaxValue, then the left text will be placed at the start of each line after any leading white space.

Determines where the right text will be placed. If trailingColumn is positive, the right text will start at this specified column (unless that line is longer than the specified column, in which case the right text will start at the end of the line). If trailingColumn is zero, then right text will be placed at the end of each line. If trailingColumn is less than zero, then the right text will be placed at the end of each line before any trailing white space.
If true, empty lines and lines consisting of white-space only will be modified. If false, empty lines and lines entirely consisting of white-space will be untouched.
Text to be displayed in the undo stack for this embedding.
If true, the embedded text will be formatted.
If true, the current selection will be indented.
Specifies the final position of the caret after embedding.
Specifies how the selection will be adjusted after embedding.

member.summary: Wraps code around the currently selected text. Text may be inserted on the line above the selection and on the line after the selection, as well as to the left and right of each line.
member.param: A string array to insert above the current selection.
A string array to insert below the current selection.
The text to place on the left side of each line.
The text to place on the right side of each line.

Determines where the left text will be inserted. If trailingColumn is positive, the left text will start at this specified column (unless code on this line starts before the specified column, in which case the left text will be inserted just before the first non-white space character on the line). If leadingColumn is one, then left text will be placed at the start of each line. If trailingColumn is int.MaxValue, then the left text will be placed at the start of each line after any leading white space.

Determines where the right text will be placed. If trailingColumn is positive, the right text will start at this specified column (unless that line is longer than the specified column, in which case the right text will start at the end of the line). If trailingColumn is zero, then right text will be placed at the end of each line. If trailingColumn is less than zero, then the right text will be placed at the end of each line before any trailing white space.
If true, empty lines and lines consisting of white-space only will be modified. If false, empty lines and lines entirely consisting of white-space will be untouched.

If true, then the specified left text will not be added to the first line, and the specified right text will not be added to the last line. If false, the left and right text will be added to every line.
Text to be displayed in the undo stack for this embedding.
If true, the embedded text will be formatted.
If true, the current selection will be indented.
If true, then the start of the selection will be extended to the start of the first line, and the end of the selection will be extended to the end of the last line.
Specifies the final position of the caret after embedding.
Specifies how the selection will be adjusted after embedding.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.ApplyQueuedEdits(System.String)
member.summary: Applies all edits in the queue. You can place new insert, delete, and replace edit operations into the edit queue using the QueueDelete, QueueInsert, and QueueReplace methods. You can get a list of all pending edits by querying the QueuedEdits property. This operation is wrapped in an undo/redo stack entry with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the operation you are performing. This text (if not empty and not null) will appear in the undo/redo stack. Passing a null or empty string will cause this method to apply the queued edits without a parent undo wrapper.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.ApplyQueuedEdits(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies all edits in the queue. You can place new insert, delete, and replace edit operations into the edit queue using the QueueDelete, QueueInsert, and QueueReplace methods. You can get a list of all pending edits by querying the QueuedEdits property. This operation is wrapped in an undo/redo stack entry with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the operation you are performing. This text (if not empty and not null) will appear in the undo/redo stack. Passing a null or empty string will cause this method to apply the queued edits without a parent undo wrapper.
Specifies if the text should be formatted.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.ApplyQueuedEdits
member.summary: Applies all edits in the queue. You can place new insert, delete, and replace edit operations into the edit queue using the QueueDelete, QueueInsert, and QueueReplace methods. You can get a list of all pending edits by querying the QueuedEdits property. This overload does not create its own undo/redo stack entry. If you want to wrap these changes in a single undo entry, use the other ApplyQueuedEdits overload, passing a non-empty string to the operation parameter.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.StoreInsertionPoint(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.InsertionPointOptions)
member.summary: Stores a new insertion point that can be used during text expansion or other text-manipulation process. To use the insertion point, create a text expansion that contains a "GotoInsertionPoint" text command and pass the name of the insertion point as the "Name" parameter, or you can call the GotoInsertionPoint method directly from your plug-in. NOTE: Stored insertion points have very short lives -- they are deleted after every text expansion. If you need to keep an edit point around for a longer period of time, call CodeRush.EditPoints.CreateEditPoint() and store the result in a field of your plug-in.
member.param: The name of the new insertion point.
The line number of the new insertion point.
The character offset of the new insertion point.
Specifies options to use when creating the new insertion point.

To use the insertion point, create a text expansion that contains a "GotoInsertionPoint" text command and pass the name of the insertion point as the "Name" parameter, or you can call the GotoInsertionPoint method directly from your plug-in. NOTE: Stored insertion points have very short lives -- they are deleted after every text expansion. If you need to keep an edit point around for a longer period of time, call CodeRush.EditPoints.CreateEditPoint() and store the result in a field of your plug-in.
member.param: The name of the new insertion point.
The line number of the new insertion point.
The character offset of the new insertion point.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.GetChildFilePaths
member.summary: Returns the file paths of any child items that belong to this TextDocument (if any). For example, if this TextDocument represents a Windows Forms designer, this method will return the file path of the .resx or .Designer.cs file. NOTE: This method is not recursive -- it only retrieves the file paths of the immediate children.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.EndAnalysis

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.ClearFieldsOnExpanding
member.summary: Defines if TextFields should be cleared before expanding the new fields. This property is for testing omly - to be able to compare result with expected value.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.CompilerDirectives
member.summary: Returns the compiler directives for this document, or null if this document's language does not support compiler directives.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.CompilerDirectiveRootNode
member.summary: Returns the compiler directive root node for this document, or null if this document's language does not support compiler directives. The root node's children (accessed through its Nodes property) are the CompilerDirectives for this file. This root node itself, however, is not an actual CompilerDirective for this file (even though its type is CompilerDirective, it does not represent an actual CompilerDirective -- it is merely the parent of the CompilerDirectives in this file).

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.HasUncommittedTextChanges
member.summary: True if this document contains text changes on the active line that have not been committed. Text changes are committed when the file is saved, when the document deactivates, and when the Enter key is pressed (or when the caret otherwise leaves the active line).

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.QueuedEdits
member.summary: A collection of SandboxEdit descendants that represent pending edits for this document. You can place new insert, delete, and replace edit operations into the edit queue using the QueueDelete, QueueInsert, and QueueReplace methods. You can apply pending edits using the ApplyQueuedEdits method.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Range
member.summary: Returns the full range of this TextDocument.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Regions
member.summary: Returns the regions for this document, or null if this document's language does not support regions.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.RegionRootNode
member.summary: Returns the region root node for this document, or null if this document's language does not support regions. The root node's children (accessed through its Nodes property) are the RegionDirectives for this file. This root node itself, however, is not an actual RegionDirectives for this file (even though its type is RegionDirectives, it does not represent an actual RegionDirectives -- it is merely the parent of the regions in this file).

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Selection
member.summary: Returns the TextSelection Object associated with the TextDocument object, either the active pane, or the top pane if neither is active.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Size
member.summary: Returns total size of document in characters.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.SourceModelCache
member.summary: The SourceModelCache for this TextDocument. Used to maintain parse status.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.StartPoint
member.summary: Returns the TextPoint Object representing the beginning of the text document.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Strings
member.summary: Returns the strings for this document, or null if this document's language does not support strings.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Text
member.summary: Gets the entire text of this document as a string.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.AllowEditsWhileDebugging
member.summary: Indicates whether or not language service allows writing to this text buffer during debugging.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.TextFieldCount
member.summary: The number of TextFields inside this document.

member.summary: A collection of TextFields for this document.

member.summary: A target for the TextFields in a document.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.FinalTextFieldTarget
member.summary: A final target for the TextFields in a document.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.HasSplitView
member.summary: Returns true if the TextView associated with this TextDocument is split into two views.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.PrimaryView
member.summary: Returns the primary (top) view of the TextView split associated with this TextDocument. If the view is not split, the TextView for this TextDOcument is returned.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.SecondaryView
member.summary: Returns the secondary (bottom) view of the TextView split associated with this TextDocument. If the view is not split, null is returned.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.LastActiveView
member.summary: Returns the last active view of this TextDocument. If the TextDocument has a split view, the most recently focused TextView in the split is returned.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.Active
member.summary: Gets the active TextDocument.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.DevExpress#CodeRush#StructuralParser#IDocument#ActiveView
member.summary: Gets the active TextView associated with this TextDocument. Can return null if no TextViews are available for this document.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument.DevExpress#CodeRush#StructuralParser#IDocument#InactiveView
member.summary: Gets the first inactive ITextView associated with this TextDocument. Can return null if no ITextViews are available for this document, or if the only available ITextView is active.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.VSTextStreamReader.SetEndPosition(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the _EndPosition field of this TextReader and ensures that it won't be set to a value that is greater than the size of the underlying IVsTextStream.

member.summary: Sets up the initial positions of this TextReader. NOTE: This is called by the constructors.

member.summary: Moves the position of this reader to the specified line and character offset.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocumentReader.StartLine
member.summary: Gets the starting line of the source that was parsed. If the entire document was parsed, will return 1. Otherwise, if a segment of the document was parsed, this property will return the line number that started the parse.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocumentReader.StartColumn
member.summary: Gets the starting column of the source that was parsed. If the entire document was parsed, will return 1. Otherwise, if a segment of the document was parsed, this property will return the column number on the first line that started the parse.

member.name: P:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocumentReader.DevExpress#CodeRush#StructuralParser#ISourceReader#IsDocumentReader
member.summary: Returns true if this reader works directly with VS document.

member.name: T:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ExpansionBuilder
member.summary: Provides a high-level mechanism to create and expand DXCore text expansions.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ExpansionBuilder.AppendText(System.String)
member.summary: Appends the specified text onto the end of the internal _Builder instance.
member.param: The text string to add.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ExpansionBuilder.AddFileBase
member.summary: Adds a "FileBase" string provider to this text expansion. When expanded, the base name (file name without the file extension) of the current file will be inserted at this position.

member.summary: Adds a "FileName" string provider to this text expansion. When expanded, the file name of the current file will be inserted at this position.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ExpansionBuilder.AddFilePath
member.summary: Adds a "FilePath" string provider to this text expansion. When expanded, the directory path of the current file will be inserted at this position.

member.summary: Inserts a text field at the caret position with the specified text.
member.param: The text of the text field to insert.
The hint to display when the text field is active.
member.remarks: Adds a "FieldStart/FieldEnd" TextCommands to this text expansion.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ExpansionBuilder.AddLink(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a linked identifier at the caret position with the specified text. Any other linked identifiers in this expansion with the same text will be connected to this one.
member.param: The text of the linked identifier to insert.
member.remarks: Adds a "Link" TextCommand to this text expansion.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ExpansionBuilder.AddMemberName
member.summary: Adds a "Member" string provider to this text expansion. When expanded, the name of the current member (method, property or field) will be inserted at this position.

member.summary: Adds a "ProjectFileName" string provider to this text expansion. When expanded, the file name of the curent project will be inserted at this position.

member.summary: Adds a "ProjectName" string provider to this text expansion. When expanded, the name of the current project will be inserted at this position.

member.remarks: Adds a "Link" TextCommand to this text expansion.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.ITextExpansionEngine.Insert(DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextDocument,DevExpress.CodeRush.StructuralParser.SourcePoint,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts text containing encoded text commands at the active cursor point.

The postion at which the template should be expanded.
Text to insert at the cursor. This text can contain embedded text commands.

member.name: T:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextExpansionHelper
member.summary: TextExpansionHelper is used internally by BeforeTemplateExpandEventArgs, AfterTemplateExpandEventArgs and ExecuteTextCommandEventArgs to provide functionality useful during a text expansion. Do not instantiate this class and use it as it may have unexpected results.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextExpansionHelper.StorePosition(System.String)
member.summary: Stores the current position of the caret. This is generally used if something meaningful should happen *after* the template is fully expanded. For example, the DXCore uses this to select text and restore the caret position after expansion.
member.param: A unique name by which an EditPoint representing the stored position can be retrieved.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextExpansionHelper.StorePosition(System.String,System.Boolean)

member.param: A unique name by which an EditPoint representing the stored position can be retrieved.

member.summary: Inserts text containing encoded TextCommands and StringProviders at the active cursor point in the specified TextDocument. Multiline text is left-aligned to the active cursor column. String providers embedded within the text

If true, allows TextCommands to cancel the insertion of text.

member.name: T:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection
member.summary: TextSelection is a CodeRush wrapper around EnvDTE.TextSelection, providing additional methods and properties to make it easier to manipulate text.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.PadToVirtualSpace
member.summary: Pads the end of the current line with spaces to fill out any virtual space between the end of the line and the cursor. Does not change the line if the cursor is not in virtual space.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.InsideVirtualSpace
member.summary: Determines if the cursor is inside virtual space.
member.returns: Returns true if the ActivePoint is inside virtual space.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.ExtendToWholeLines
member.summary: Extends the selection to include complete lines. If nothing is selected, then no change occurs. If the last line in the selection contains no selected text (e.g., the anchor or active point is at the start of the line), then that line is not included in the selection.

member.summary: Inserts text, overwriting the existing text.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.EndOfDocument(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the object to the end of the document.
member.param: If Extend is True, then only the active end of the selected text is moved. Otherwise, the selected text is collapsed (no selection) and the caret is positioned at the end of the document.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.EndOfLine(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the selection to the end of the current line.
member.param: If Extend is True, then only the active end of the selected text is moved. Otherwise, the selected text is collapsed (e.g., no selection) and positioned at the end of the document.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.FindPattern(System.String,System.Int32,EnvDTE.TextRanges@)
member.summary: Searches for the given pattern from the active point to the end of the document. The return value indicates whether the pattern is found. If the pattern is found, the edit point is moved to the beginning of the match. Otherwise, the edit location is unchanged.
member.param: The text to find.

One or more vsFindOptions constants (one of vsFindOptionsBackwards, vsFindOptionsFromStart, vsFindOptionsKeepModifiedDocumentsOpen, vsFindOptionsMatchCase, vsFindOptionsMatchInHiddenText, vsFindOptionsMatchWholeWord, vsFindOptionsNone, vsFindOptionsRegularExpression, vsFindOptionsSearchSubfolders, or vsFindOptionsWildcards).
If the matched pattern is a regular expression containing tagged subexpressions, then Tags argument contains a collection of TextRange Objects, one for each tagged sub-expression.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.FindText(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Searches for the given pattern from the active point to the end of the document. The return value indicates whether the pattern is found. If the pattern is found, the edit point is moved to the beginning of the match. Otherwise, the edit location is unchanged.
member.param: The text to find.

One or more vsFindOptions constants (one of vsFindOptionsBackwards, vsFindOptionsFromStart, vsFindOptionsKeepModifiedDocumentsOpen, vsFindOptionsMatchCase, vsFindOptionsMatchInHiddenText, vsFindOptionsMatchWholeWord, vsFindOptionsNone, vsFindOptionsRegularExpression, vsFindOptionsSearchSubfolders, or vsFindOptionsWildcards).

member.summary: Moves to the beginning of the indicated line and selects the line if requested.
member.param: The line number to go to, starting with one.
Indicates whether the target line should be selected.

member.summary: Indents the selected lines by the given number of indentation levels.
member.param: The number of display indent levels to indent each selected line.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.Insert(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts the specified Text at the cursor.

A vsInsertFlags constant indicating how to treat the inserted text (one of vsInsertFlagsCollapseToEnd, vsInsertFlagsCollapseToStart, vsInsertFlagsContainNewText, vsInsertFlagsInsertAtEnd, or vsInsertFlagsInsertAtStart).

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.InsertFromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts the contents of the specified file at the current location in the buffer.
member.param: The name of the file to insert into the text buffer.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.LineDown(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the selection (caret) down a specified number of lines. If the end of the document is encountered before Count lines, then the position remains at the end of the document. LineDown tries to match the display column from the line of origin to the target line, rounding down a character position, if necessary, if it ends up in the middle of a tab on the target line.
member.param: Determines whether the selection is extended to include this new line.
Indicates how many lines to move down.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.LineUp(System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves the selection (caret) up a specified number of lines. If the beginning of the document is encountered before Count lines, then the position remains at the beginning of the document. LineUp tries to match the display column from the line of origin to the target line, rounding down a character position, if necessary, if it ends up in the middle of a tab on the target line.
member.param: Determines whether the selection is extended to include this new line.
Indicates how many lines to move up.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.MoveTo(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the active point to the specified line and column.
member.param: The line number, starting at one, from the beginning of the buffer.
Represents the column, starting at one, that is the new column location.
Determines whether the selection extends to the new location.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.MoveToAbsoluteOffset(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the active point to the given 1-based absolute character offset, optionally extending the selection to include that offset.
member.param: A character index from the start of the document, starting at one.

Determines whether the current selection should be extended to the offset. If Extend is True, then the active end of the selection moves to the location while the anchor end remains in place. If false, both ends are moved to the specified location.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.MoveToDisplayColumn(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the active point to the indicated display column. This method accepts the column value as though the editor were in virtual space mode. If the column offset is in the middle of a tab character in the line, the active point is moved to the position immediately preceding the tab. If the values of Line or Column are zero, then the active point remains at the current line number and/or column number.
member.param: The line number, starting at one, from the beginning of the buffer, or alternatively a vsGotoLineOptions constant (either vsGotoLineOptionsLast or vsGotoLineOptionsFirst).
Represents the virtual display column, starting at one, that is the new column location.
Determines whether the selection extends to the new location.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.MoveToLineAndOffset(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the ActivePoint to the given position. If the value of Offset is beyond the last character of the line, the selection includes the end of the line.
member.param: The line number, starting at one, from the beginning of the buffer, or alternatively a vsGotoLineOptions constant (either vsGotoLineOptionsLast or vsGotoLineOptionsFirst).
The character index position in the line, starting at one.
Determines whether the selection extends to the new location.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.MoveToPoint(EnvDTE.TextPoint,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves the active point to the given position.
member.param: The location to move the caret.
Determines whether the selection extends to the new location.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.NewLine(System.Int32)
member.summary: Inserts one or more line break characters at the ActivePoint.
member.param: Represents the number of line break characters to insert. If the value of Count is negative, or greater than or equal to 10,000, then NewLine fails.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.NextBookmark
member.summary: Moves the insertion point to the next bookmark. Returns true if successful.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.OutlineSection
member.summary: Creates an outlining section based on the current selection.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.PadToColumn(System.Int32)
member.summary: Fills the current line in the buffer with empty characters (white space) to the given column. PadToColumn inserts tabs and spaces, according to global settings, from the selection's display column to the specified display column. If the active end of the selection already lies beyond the specified column, PadToColumn does nothing. The selection immediately follows the inserted white space and is collapsed.
member.param: The number of columns to pad, starting at one.

member.summary: Exchanges the position of the active and the anchor points.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.Tabify
member.summary: Converts contiguous spaces to tabs within the selected text according to the global setting for a tab's size.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.Unindent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes indents from the selected text by the number of indentation levels given. This method does not perform smart formatting or remove indents for lines based on the context of the code. Tabs and characters are deleted and inserted as necessary to remove one indentation level according to the current global settings for tab and indent level size. Unindent behaves differently depending on whether the selected text is continuous or columnar. If it's continuous, indents are removed from all lines partially or completely within the selection at the first column. If it's a columnar selection, indents are removed from the selected text at the left edge of the selection.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.TextSelection.Untabify
member.summary: Converts all tabs to spaces within the selected text according to the global setting for a tab's size.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.IGdiTextView.Invalidate(EnvDTE.TextPoint,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Invalidates a rectangular region the text view at the specified text point. The size of the region is determined by the width & height parameters. member.param: The TextPoint or EditPoint to invalidate at.
The width of the rectangular region, in pixels.
The height of the rectangular region, in pixels.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.IGdiTextView.Invalidate(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Invalidates a rectangular region the text view at the specified line and column offset. The size of the region is determined by the width & height parameters. The invalidated region is centered on the center of the line at the specified line and columnOffset. If the specified line and column offset is not visible, the invalidation will not occur.
member.param: The line number to invalidate at.
The column offset to invalidate at. This can be in virtual space.
The width of the rectangular region, in pixels.
The height of the rectangular region, in pixels.

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.IGdiTextView.ShowMenu(System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays the specified context menu at the client coordinate positions (relative to this TextView). The context menu's Popup event is triggered before showing. If a menu item is selected, its Click event will be triggered before returning from this method. This method hides the editor caret (cursor) before displaying the popup, and restores it when the popup menu is closed.
member.param: The context menu to display.
The client X coordinate (relative to this TextView).
The client Y coordinate (relative to this TextView).

member.name: M:DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.IGdiTextView.ShowMenu(System.Windows.Forms.ContextMenu,DevExpress.CodeRush.Core.Tile)
member.summary: Displays the specified context menu at the specified Tile. The context menu's Popup event is triggered before showing. If a menu item is selected, its Click event will be triggered before returning from this method. This method hides the editor caret (cursor) before displaying the popup, and restores it when the popup menu is closed.
member.param: The context menu to display.
The tile to display the menu at. The menu will be positioned directly underneath the Tile.

The character offset of the end of the segment to highlight.
The color of the line that borders the top and bottom lines of code in the segment to highlight.
